name: Skeiding Guest Farm

reviews.text: we have just returned from a 2 week holiday in South Africa, and for the first week we have the truly wonderful experience of staying at this guest farm. there were 5 of us adults and we all truly felt special. nothing was too much trouble and Neels and Anna-Lize are remarkable hosts and the food is to die for, I have never had food served with flowers, edible ones at that, that tasted so divine and looked too good to eat. The ostrich fillet is cooked on an open fire in the farmhouse in front of all the guests, all the bread is home made fresh for breakfast every morning, and the jams, also are home made. If you ask Anna-lize for a recipe she will give you it and I can't recommend any specific dishes as they were all far too speacial and at a very reasonable price too, A truly gastronomical experience with the added bonus of the whole farm being a welcoming enjoyable place to stay, The farm tour with Neels is a "must" but not for the weak hearted as he doesn't really

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at Skeiding Guest Farm. Our room was large with lovely views over the area. Our hosts were very professional but friendly. Dinner and breakfast was very 'moreish'! The farm working tour in the morning was excellent and certainly not put on for tourists. Would certainly stopover here again when travelling on the N2.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We included the skeiding guest farm on our route to cape town because we'd read the recommendations on trip advisor. The guest farm is close to the N2 and easily reachable, the scenery is great, very quiet with the mountains almost at your fingertips. The room was okay,but quite dark. But what made us think that we had to write a review about the guest farm that differs from the ones we had read were the owners: Actually we had the impression that the hosts weren't really interested in their guests. While we had dinner, they sat in the kitchen, not willing to spend a minute more to talk to us thea necessary. Same in the morning while having breakfast (which was actually really good!): the owner came to the breakfast table to pour a glass of orange juice and left?!? All in all we would not go there again.
reviews.title: Maybe a question of expectations

reviews.text: We recently undertook a road trip from Port Elizabeth to Cape Town and stayed at various places along the route. Skeiding was a real highlight. We had wonderful time. The accomodation was homely and cosy and the warmest accomodation that we had during a really cold winter week. The dinner was outstanding. We fancy ourselves as steak fundis and found Neels' ostrich to be the best we have ever tasted. The meal was accompanied by real South African farm delicacies which were just as good. The kids loved the labyrinth and we all enjoyed a lovely long walk with great views in the evening and in the early morning an exciting farm trip. Neels was really kind and went the extra mile for us. Even assisting with fixing our motor car troubles! We really enjoyed the true and wholsome South African hospitality. A really great experience. We will be back.
reviews.title: a truly South African experience

reviews.text: While on D-TOURS cycle tour stopped over for the night..great welcome very comfortable sleep exelent food.................. most interesting farm visit .will be back !

reviews.title: Wish we'd stayed longer - A perfect stop between Cape Town & Garden Route

description: Skeiding is one of those places that you fall in love with for no reason ... maybe it's the absolute peace and tranquillity or the panoramic views of the Langeberg mountains or the bright stars at night or the mouth watering food or the goodness of being close to nature ... that makes you want to come back. Situated on high, open, rolling terrain you experience the feeling of freedom and being kind of alone with no neighbour in sight. Skeiding is a working grain, sheep, ostrich and Nguni farm … close to the N2 and halfway (250 km) between Cape Town and Knysna. This makes us the ideal stopover. A friendly family farm, an education for city slickers, a place to relax and enjoy panoramic mountain views as the farm is situated on high, open rolling terrain. We Neels and Anné-Lize is two energetic people who love life …you need to be to run a farm, a young family (Anné and Pieter), two dogs (Dixie and Jessie), a cat (Tierkat) and a guesthouse in the same lifetime.Spoil yourself and stay Bed & Breakfast or even better, have dinner.Our sumptuous farm breakfast include : a plate of fruit in season, at least a dozen homemade preserves and jams, freshly baked bread, vetkoek ( a traditional farm fried bread), a cheese platter, cereals, yogurt, eggs and also a choice between ostrich and pork bacon..Enjoy home cooked country cuisine prepared by Anné-Lize and her small team of able and enthusiastic assistants. Neels is the meat “chef” on the open fire, unless farm work calls him away. A three course
